Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • Item
      • Ball

  • public class Ball
extends Item
    This class holds all info of a ball: size, position, speed, and so on.
    Version:
    2013-05-14
    Author:
    Jonathan Olergård, Jack Shabo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ball()
      Will create a ball with default position, speed and size.
      Ball(int coordX, int coordY, int speedX, int speedY, int size)
      Will create a ball using the specified parameters for start position, speed and size.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getSize() 
      void reset()
      Will place the ball at the default (starting) position.
      void setSize(int size) 

      • Methods inherited from class Item

        getPosX, getPosY, getSizeX, getSizeY, getSpeedX, getSpeedY, setPosX, setPosY, setSizeX, setSizeY, setSpeedX, setSpeedY

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball()
        Will create a ball with default position, speed and size.

      • Ball

        public Ball(int coordX,
    int coordY,
    int speedX,
    int speedY,
    int size)
        Will create a ball using the specified parameters for start position, speed and size.
        Parameters:
        coordX - The ball's beginning X coordinate.
        coordY - The ball's beginning Y coordinate.
        speedX - The ball's beginning speed X-wise.
        speedY - The ball's beginning speed Y-wise.
        size - The ball's beginning size.

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        The size of the ball.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        Parameters:
        size - The size to set the ball to.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Will place the ball at the default (starting) position.
